alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Le Flore; McIntosh; Muskogee; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 2:28AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Haskell, northeastern McIntosh, southwestern Sequoyah, northwestern Le Flore and southeastern Muskogee Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 227 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Porum, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Sallisaw... Stigler... Muldrow... Warner... Porum... Webbers Falls... Keota... Mccurtain... Bokoshe... Whitefield... Gans... Tamaha... Briartown... Mc Curtain... Cowlington... Kanima... Milton... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 268 and 290, between mile markers 299 and 301, and between mile markers 313 and 318. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for southeastern and east central Oklahoma.

area.areaDesc: Haskell; Le Flore; McIntosh; Muskogee; Sequoyah
